item.title: CBSニュースのキャサリン・ヘリッジ記者は、2017年に書いたフォックス・ニュースの記事の情報源を明らかにしなければ、法廷侮辱罪の制裁と罰金に直面する可能性がある（Jeremy Barr/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Jeremy Barr / Washington Post:
CBS News journalist Catherine Herridge could face a contempt of court sanction and fines if she does not reveal a source for Fox News stories she wrote in 2017  —  First Amendment advocates are alarmed by the case of Catherine Herridge, who is facing an imminent court deadline and steep fines

item.title: リー・エンタープライゼズ、第4四半期の営業収入は前年同期比15.3％減の1億6400万ドル、純損失は前年同期比80％減の130万ドル、デジタルのみの契約者数は前年同期比36％増の72万1000人（リー・エンタープライゼズ、Inc.）
item.description:
Lee Enterprises, Inc.:
Lee Enterprises reports Q4 operating revenue down 15.3% YoY to $164M, net loss down 80% YoY to $1.3M, and digital-only subscribers up 36% YoY to 721K  —  Total Digital Revenue(1) was $73M in the quarter, representing 44% of revenue  —  Digital-only subscribers total 721,000, exceeding guidance and up 36% YOY

item.title: チャレンジャー、グレイ＆クリスマス：メディア業界のニュース部門では、2023年1月から11月までに2,681人の人員削減が行われ、2022年または2021年の全期間よりも多い（ポインター誌）
item.description:
Poynter:
Challenger, Gray & Christmas: the news sector of the media industry has seen 2,681 job cuts from January through November 2023, more than in all of 2022 or 2021  —  The news sector alone has lost 2,681 jobs so far in 2023 — more than it did in all of 2022 or 2021.

item.title: ABCニュースは、1月18日にニューハンプシャーで第6回共和党大統領予備選討論会を開催する予定。
item.description:
Nick Robertson / The Hill:
ABC News plans to host the sixth Republican presidential primary debate, in New Hampshire on January 18, three days before a CNN debate at the same location  —  ABC News announced Thursday that it will host the sixth GOP debate on Jan. 18 in Manchester, New Hampshire, set to take place just days before a CNN event at the same location.

item.title: スカイダンス・メディアのデヴィッド・エリソンCEOとレッドバード・キャピタルのジェリー・カーディナーレが、パラマウントの資産買収について「検討中」との報道を受け、パラマウントの株価が約14％上昇（Lucas Manfredi/The Wrap）
item.description:
Lucas Manfredi / The Wrap:
Paramount's stock jumps ~14% over reports Skydance Media CEO David Ellison and RedBird Capital's Gerry Cardinale are “kicking the tires” on acquiring its assets  —  The companies are reportedly interested in parent company National Amusements' majority stake in the media conglomerate

item.title: 情報筋レン・ブラバトニク氏が支援するスポーツ・ストリーミング企業DAZNグループが、世界展開を加速するため、10億ドル規模の資金調達方法を模索中（Bloomberg）
item.description:
Bloomberg:
Sources: DAZN Group, the sports streaming company backed by Len Blavatnik, is exploring ways to raise as much as $1B, seeking to accelerate its global expansion  —  - Blavatnik's sports broadcaster holds talks with advisers  — CEO previously said DAZN would welcome strategic partners

item.title: 情報源Xはアマゾンと予備協議を行い、アマゾンの広告購入ソフト、パブマティックを通じて広告を利用できるようにし、より多くの小規模広告主を引きつけることを狙っている（ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナル）。
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Sources: X has held preliminary talks with Amazon to make ads available via Amazon's ad-buying software, and PubMatic, seeking to attract more small advertisers  —  Social-media platform has had preliminary talks with Amazon to sell ads through e-commerce giant's ad-buying software

item.title: EU諸国のThreads.netホームページでのみ閲覧可能なタイトル未定のカウントダウンタイマーは、12月14日にEUユーザーにもサービスが拡大されることを示唆している（Jess Weatherbed/The Verge）
item.description:
Jess Weatherbed / The Verge:
An untitled countdown timer viewable only on the Threads.net homepage in EU countries suggests that the service will be expanded to EU users on December 14  —  Following its rollout in countries like the US and UK this past July, Threads will finally be expanded to users in the European Union on December 14th.

item.title: 米国の読者約1,483人を対象とした実験によると、報道機関がAIによって作成された記事と表示した場合、人々は報道機関の信頼性が低いと認識した（Sarah Scire/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Sarah Scire / Nieman Lab:
An experiment involving nearly 1,483 US readers showed that people perceived news outlets as less trustworthy when the outlets labeled articles as AI-generated  —  “We already expect quite a lot from the public in terms of media literacy to be able to navigate the contemporary information environment …

Reuters:
Axel Springer is shutting down its news aggregator app Upday at the end of December and plans to relaunch it as a “trend news generator” driven by AI in 2024  —  Axel Springer is shutting down the news outlet Upday, the German publishing giant said on Friday, in plans to revive the brand as a …

After a Reuters report found that Israel fired the shells that killed journalist Issam Abdallah on October 13, Israel says Abdallah was in an active combat zone  —  The Israeli military, responding on Friday to a Reuters investigation that determined its forces killed a Reuters journalist …

item.description:
Sam Kille / Report for America:
Report for America adds dozens of host newsroom partners and opens applications for 50+ reporting jobs, including seven involving statehouse coverage for the AP  —  Report for America has announced the selection of dozens of new host newsroom partners while opening applications for just over 50 …

item.title: ライオンの収益拡大フェローシップからの教訓：収益拡大には、運営準備、明確な戦略、リーダーの関与、適切な人材の採用が必要（リサ・ヘイモト／ライオン・パブリッシャーズ）
item.description:
Lisa Heyamoto / LION Publishers:
Lessons from LION's Revenue Growth Fellowship: revenue growth requires operational readiness, a clear strategy, leader involvement, and hiring the right person  —  How strategy, structure and consistency are essential for revenue growth, and other lessons learned from our Revenue Growth Fellowship

item.title: ArtforumのYear in Review号は、編集長デイヴィッド・ヴェラスコの解雇後、ボイコットが続く中、2022年12月号より遅れて到着し、約3分の1に縮小された（Zachary Small/New York Times）

Zachary Small / New York Times:
Artforum's Year in Review issue arrives late and about a third smaller than December 2022's issue, as a boycott endures after its firing of editor David Velasco  —  The magazine's first issue since its top editor was fired is noticeably slimmer.  Contributors pulled articles because of the response …
